info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Polk, northeastern Greenville and northwestern Spartanburg Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Columbus to 10 miles southeast of Hendersonville to 16 miles southeast of Brevard. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Landrum, Inman, Tryon, Campobello, Saluda, Tigerville, Lake Bowen, Lake Robinson and Pleasant Ridge State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
